channel.title: Comments on: SQL University – SQL Server Reporting Services: Exploring the RSReportServer.config File
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: I don't know; I've never tried.

item.title: By: NicT
item.dc:creator: NicT
item.description: we like to do everything by script as it is much easier to work out what and when things went right or wrong. Is there a way of updating these files using XML or WMI?
item.content:encoded: we like to do everything by script as it is much easier to work out what and when things went right or wrong. Is there a way of updating these files using XML or WMI?

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: @Virul - The easiest thing I can suggest you do is to search the server for *.config - you should find it somewhere in your SQL Server directory.
item.content:encoded: @Virul – The easiest thing I can suggest you do is to search the server for *.config – you should find it somewhere in your SQL Server directory.

item.title: By: Virul Patel
item.dc:creator: Virul Patel
item.content:encoded:
I need to change ◦RSReportServer.config file. But i dont find the file on the path you specified.

Our reporting server is Native setup and not sharepoint configuration.

Can you help me to find ◦RSReportServer.config file?

Thanks

item.title: By: Rashid Khan
item.dc:creator: Rashid Khan
item.description: Excellent article... thank you.... Rashid Khan

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: @kolept - I'm unable to help with a data processing extension question. Perhaps this will help? http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/22946/Implementing-a-Data-Processing-Extension
item.content:encoded: @kolept – I’m unable to help with a data processing extension question. Perhaps this will help? http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/22946/Implementing-a-Data-Processing-Extension

item.title: By: kolept
item.dc:creator: kolept
item.description: I have a question on the data processing extension.I have created a data processing extension to pull two different oracle datasource and merged into a dataset and return.I would like to know that do data processing extension share the<br /> WebServiceUseFileShareStorage feature? Or I need to add code in my data processing extension to call report processor to cached reports and snapshots into the tempdb?
item.content:encoded:
I have a question on the data processing extension.I have created a data processing extension to pull two different oracle datasource and merged into a dataset and return.I would like to know that do data processing extension share the
WebServiceUseFileShareStorage feature? Or I need to add code in my data processing extension to call report processor to cached reports and snapshots into the tempdb?

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Naomi, I think it's a great resource and you'll learn a lot! Enjoy SQL U.
item.content:encoded: Naomi, I think it’s a great resource and you’ll learn a lot! Enjoy SQL U.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
Interesting, thanks for the post and thanks for referring to SQL University. Looks like a very good way to increase my knowledge.

I’m going to read these blogs.
